Assessment.QuestionText: Which of these statements about <font face="courier new">Color</font> structure, <font face="courier new">Pen</font> class, and <font face="courier new">Brush</font> class are true and which statements are false?

Options.Option: The <font face="courier new">Color</font> structure supports creation of transparent colors using the alpha value.
The <font face="courier new">Color</font> structure exists in <font face="courier new">System.Drawing.Color</font> namespace.
The <font face="courier new">Argb</font> property creates a <font face="courier new">Color</font> structure from the particular name of a predefined color.
The <font face="courier new">Transform</font> property of the <font face="courier new">Pen</font> class identifies the geometric transformation for the pen.
The <font face="courier new">SetNativeBrush()</font> method of the <font face="courier new">Brush</font> class gets the reference of the GDI+ brush.

Assessment.CorrectFeedback: Yes, that's correct! You get one point for your response.
Assessment.incorrectFeedback: No, that's incorrect. The correct selections are: (A)-(True), (B)-(False), (C)-(False), (D)-(True), and (E)-(True).
